Gaza: Denmark refuses to take in Palestinian patients
subhead: While 11 EU countries have already admitted wounded evacuees from the Gaza Strip, Copenhagen continues to oppose the measure, citing concerns over a potential increase in family reunification requests.

title: In Istanbul, soaring rents put the middle class under pressure
subhead: The cost of housing has spiraled out of control in the Turkish capital, driven by hyperinflation and the collapse of the national currency.

title: In 'Kolkhoze,' Emmanuel Carrère becomes his mother's son
subhead: In his new book, the French author reflects on his often tumultuous relationship with his late mother, Hélène Carrère d'Encausse, and explores what he owes her. This major work addresses themes of death, love and writing.

title: The books we accumulate but will never read are 'less a burden than a form of wealth'
subhead: 'Letters from America' (5/6). Writer and journalist Thomas Chatterton Williams sees beauty in accumulating thousands of books in his library, knowing that a single lifetime would never be enough to read them all – a beauty found in an unexplored world.

In the Donbas, a Ukrainian high schooler's rebellion against Russification
subhead: At her Russian-controlled high school near Luhansk, a pro-Ukrainian teenager who resisted propaganda was the target of relentless disciplinary action since January. Fearing that she could be placed in foster care or even adopted, her mother decided to flee the occupied territory.

title: Why heat and drought are making trees look like autumn is coming early
subhead: In some regions, drought combined with extreme heat has led to defoliation, a phenomenon that, if recurring, can cause forest dieback.

title: What is Kick, the platform on which a French streamer died live?
subhead: Raphaël Grave, known online as Jean Pormanove, died Monday during a livestream. The tragedy has shed light on a little-known streaming site and its extremely permissive moderation policies.
